entry.title: Launch Sublime 3 From the Command Line
entry.content:
Under a GNU/Linux enviroment like Ubuntu when you install sublime 2/3 you’ll also get a command line utility to launch the program. Sadly in OSx we don’t have it, but it is quiet easy to get that feature to work, just type on a terminal:

bash $ ln -s /Applications/Sublime\ Text.app/Contents/SharedSupport/bin/subl /usr/local/bin/subl

Et voilà, now you can launch sublime from the terminal just typing subl.
